required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Investigate Efficacy and Safety of KBL697 in Patients With Moderate Plaque Type Psoriasis
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of KBL697 in Patients With Moderate Plaque Type Psoriasis

brief_summary.textblock: The study is designed to investigate efficacy and safety of KBL697 in patients with Moderate Plaque Type Psoriasis. KBL697 has been developed as a potential new treatment for Psoriatic Plaque.

primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in PASI score

secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in PASI score
Percent of patients who achieved PASI-50
Percent of patients who achieved PASI-75
Change from Baseline in PGA score
Percent of patients who achieve PGA score of 0 or 1
Change from Baseline in Psoriasis-Affected BSA

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety measure through incidence of treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of patients experiencing TEAEs and number of individual TEAEs will be summarized among treatment arms, by system organ class (SOC) and PT. TEAEs will also be summarized among treatment arms, by severity and by relationship to study drug.

arm_group.description: 39 subjects for low dose group. 26 subjects on KBL697, 13 subjects on placebo.
39 subjects for high dose group. 26 subjects on KBL697, 13 subjects on placebo.

intervention.description: 1 capsule BID of KBL697 or Placebo
5 capsules BID of KBL697 or Placebo

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged 18 to 75 years (inclusive)
- Have a diagnosis of plaque type psoriasis for â‰¥ 6 months
- Must have chronic plaque type psoriasis of moderate severity
- All subjects must agree and commit to the use of a reliable contraceptive regimen.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Current diagnosis of forms of psoriasis other than chronic plaque type only
- Drug-induced psoriasis
- Other inflammatory skin disease that may confound the evaluation of plaque psoriasis
- Failed 2 or more systemic treatments for plaque psoriasis
- Medicinal shampoos that contain tar and/or salicylic acid within 2 weeks prior to Baseline Visit
